com.twitter.heron.streamlet.impl.sources

Class StreamletSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.twitter.heron.api.topology.BaseComponent
      • com.twitter.heron.api.spout.BaseRichSpout
        • com.twitter.heron.streamlet.impl.sources.StreamletSource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IRichSpout, ISpout, IComponent, IStatefulComponent<java.io.Serializable,java.io.Serializable>, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ComplexSource, SupplierSource

    public abstract class StreamletSource
extends BaseRichSpout
implements IStatefulComponent<java.io.Serializable,java.io.Serializable>
    StreamletSource is the base class for all streamlet sources. The only common stuff amongst all of them is the output streams
    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • initState

        public void initState(State<java.io.Serializable,java.io.Serializable> state)
        Description copied from interface: IStatefulComponent
        Initializes the state of the function or operator to that of a previous checkpoint. This method is invoked when a component is executed as part of a recovery run. In case there was prior state associated with the component, the state will be empty. Stateful Spouts/Bolts are expected to hold on to the state variable to save their internal state

        Note that initialState() is called before open() or prepare().

        Specified by:
        initState in interface IStatefulComponent<java.io.Serializable,java.io.Serializable>
        Parameters:
        state - the previously saved state of the component.

      • preSave

        public void preSave(java.lang.String checkpointId)
        Description copied from interface: IStatefulComponent
        This is a hook for the component to perform some actions just before the framework saves its state.
        Specified by:
        preSave in interface IStatefulComponent<java.io.Serializable,java.io.Serializable>
        Parameters:
        checkpointId - the ID of the checkpoint

      • declareOutputFields

        public void declareOutputFields(OutputFieldsDeclarer outputFieldsDeclarer)
        The sources implementing streamlet functionality have some properties. 1. They all output only one stream 2. All streamlet operators should be able to consume their output This imply that the output stream should be named same for all of them.
        Specified by:
        declareOutputFields in interface IComponent
        Parameters:
        outputFieldsDeclarer - this is used to declare output stream ids, output fields, and whether or not each output stream is a direct stream
